Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rabbi Haskel Lookstein, Rabbi Emeritus, Congregation Kehilath Jeshurun, 125 East 85th Street, New York, N.Y. 10028.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Garodnick.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by:Rabbi Haskel Lookstein, Rabbi Emeritus, Congregation Kehilath Jeshurun, 125 East 85 Strret., New York, N.Y. 10028.



Council Member Garodnick moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 22, 2016 be adopted as printed by Council Member Barron.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Barron moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 22, 2016 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Manuel Miranda to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment as a member of the New York City Art Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 851 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Manuel Miranda,  Art Commission (Public Design Commission)

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Joseph A. Puma, candidate for re-designation by the Council to the New York City Civilian Complaint Review Board.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Joseph A. Puma, Civilian Complaint Review Board.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Van Bramer:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20.b of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application No. C 050319 MMQ shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Planning, Socrates Sculpture Park, Queens (C 050319 MMQ)

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring successor employers of buildings to retain eligible employees for a transition employment period.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon New York State Department of Education to include lessons on climate change in K-12 schoolsâ€™ curriculum.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally noted their opposition to the passage of this item: Council Members Borelli and Matteo.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: DOE to include lessons on climate change in K-12 schoolsâ€™ curriculum.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City of New York to make Earth Day 2016 a car-free day for private and all non-essential city vehicles
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Transportation
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.


The following 3 Council Members formally noted their opposition to the passage of this item:   Council Members Lancman, Ulrich and Matteo.


The following 3 Council Members formally noted their abstention on this item:  Council Members Gentile, Greenfield and Grodenchik.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Make Earth Day 2016 a car-free day for private and all non-essential city vehicles.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
